alert.note: Alert for Madison; Washington (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 02 at 2:39PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Arkansas and northeast Oklahoma, including the following counties, in northwest Arkansas, Benton, Carroll, Madison and Washington AR. In northeast Oklahoma, Delaware and Ottawa. * WHEN...Through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - 1 to 2 inches of rain have fallen in parts of the watch area since last night. Additional thunderstorms are expected this evening, with localized rainfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
